com.utilities.configfile

Class ConfigFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.utilities.configfile.ConfigFile

  • public final class ConfigFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Configuration File class. Stores a sequence of parameters in a config file for saving and loading. All parameters have a default value to use in the event that a file can't be read (or simply doesn't exist yet). Typical usage looks like: ConfigFile cfg_file = new ConfigFile( filename ); cfg_file.parameterAdd("param1",param1); cfg_file.parameterAdd("param2",param2); cfg_file.parameterAdd("param2",param3); cfg_file.load(); #This will equal the original param1 if no file could be found or that's what the file said. Object loaded_param1 = cfg_file.parameterGet("param1"); #Change loaded_param1 here cfg_file.parameterSet("param1",loaded_param1) #Saves a configuration file. The most recent values of the paramters are written. cfg_file.save();
    Author:
    Ian

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConfigFile

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public final void load()
        Attempt to load the file. All parameters will be checked first. If the configuration file is up to date (i.e., it exists, can be read, and it's contents match one-to-one with the parameters that have been added), then the file's contents will overwrite all the default values. If, however, there is any problem whatsoever, NO parameters will be changed.

      • save

        public final void save()
        Attempts to save the configuration file.

      • parameterAdd

        public final void parameterAdd(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.Object default_value)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a parameter to the configuration file. Note that that this method must be called before load() if you intend for the class to load anything from the file.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the parameter.
        default_value - the default value to set it to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this parameter already exists.

      • parameterGet

        public final java.lang.Object parameterGet(java.lang.String name)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the value of the parameter.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the parameter to get.
        Returns:
        the parameter's value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter specified by the name does not exist.

      • parameterSet

        public final void parameterSet(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.Object obj)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the value of the parameter. This should be called before save() if you want to have the contents of the file reflect your changes.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the parameter to set.
        obj - the value to set the parameter to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the parameter specified by the name does not exist.
